TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

The applicant ’s first wife died on DATE . They had CARDINAL children from the marriage born in DATE and DATE . In DATE the applicant applied for widows’ benefits and was informed that he was not entitled to these benefits as he was a man .

On DATE the applicant married his second wife . She died on DATE , leaving CARDINAL child born in DATE . He has been in receipt of income support since DATE . His claim for widows’ benefits was made in DATE and was rejected in DATE on the ground that he was not entitled to widows’ benefits because he was not a woman .

On DATE the applicant reapplied for widows’ benefits and on CARDINAL DATE he was informed that the benefits agency refused to consider his claim . By a letter of DATE the applicant challenged this rejection . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE he was informed that his only redress was by way of judicial review in ORG . The applicant initiated judicial review proceedings which were dismissed on DATE . The applicant appealed and on DATE , ORG accepted that his Convention rights had been breached but did not award damages . Both parties appealed and on CARDINAL DATE ORG accepted that the applicant ’s Convention rights had been infringed . However it rejected his claims because the Secretary of ORG had no power to make extra - statutory payments .
The domestic law relevant to this application is set out in PERSON v. the GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-IV and Runkee and White v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE .
